Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hi Chase,

The crawler beans look okay, so it could be that the correct exc=
hange and/or queue binding isn't set up in RabbtMQ. Since your crawler bean=
s are setting the `exchange` and `routingKey` properties to non-defaults, d=
id you run umbra using the exchange and routing key you defined? If you run=
 umbra with flags as "--exchange heritrix --routing-key phantomjs-domain" b=
efore launching the crawl, it should create the needed exchange and queue b=
inding for you. Similarly, the defaults of umbra and Heritrix align, so, if=
 you don't care about setting those properties differently, you could leave=
 the `exchange` and `routingKey` properties out of the crawler beans and st=
art umbra with the defaults before the crawl is launched, and it should cre=
ate the default 'umbra' exchange and  'urls' queue with appropriate binding=
 automatically.


Lauren Ko

UNT Libraries

_______________________________=
_
From: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com <archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com> o=
n behalf of 'Dooley, Chase' cdool@... [archive-crawler] <archive-crawle=
r@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, February 14, 2017 7:29:12 AM
To: 'archive=
-crawler@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: [archive-crawler] Heritrix and Umbra Set=
up



Hello!

I'm working on setting up Umbra with Heritrix for our in-hous=
e crawling efforts, and am having some difficulties. From the RabbitMQ Web =
interface, I see that connections and channels are being made; however, not=
hing is passed to the queue. I'm just wondering if this is the correct beha=
vior.

Here are the portions of the crawler beans that concern Umbra:

http=
s://gist.github.com/chasehd/b7fc2c27c9f33266c1241cedbf69415d

I used Andy J=
ackson's example (https://gist.github.com/anjackson/ce84c8aa61e6fa439e79) a=
s reference, and so that excerpt is found at the top level of the crawler b=
eans where the other Fetch Chains are defined; it's referenced, then, under=
 the fetchProcessors bean.

Thanks for your help!

Best,
Chase



--_000_BLUPR01MB168441F507B0810F6CBA0E3FE4580BLUPR01MB1684prod_

<p>Hello! <br>
<br>
I'm working on setting up Umbra with Heritrix for our i=
n-house crawling efforts, and am having some difficulties. From the RabbitM=
Q Web interface, I see that connections and channels are being made; howeve=
r, nothing is passed to the queue. I'm just wondering
 if this is the corre=
ct behavior.<br>
<br>
Here are the portions of the crawler beans that conce=
rn Umbra:<br>
<br>
https://gist.github.com/chasehd/b7fc2c27c9f33266c1241ced=
bf69415d <br>
<br>
I used Andy Jackson's example (https://gist.github.com/a=
njackson/ce84c8aa61e6fa439e79) as reference, and so that excerpt is found a=
t the top level of the crawler beans where the other Fetch Chains are defin=
ed; it's referenced, then, under the fetchProcessors
 bean.<br>
<br>
Thanks=
 for your help!<br>
<br>
Best,<br>
Chase<br>
</p>
